info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 7 at 4:57PM EDT until April 8 at 9:17PM EDT by NWS Peachtree City GA
info.description:
...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Georgia...
Oconee River at Milledgeville affecting Wilkinson, Washington and Baldwin Counties.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring.
* WHERE...Oconee River at Milledgeville.
* WHEN...From this afternoon to Tuesday evening.
* IMPACTS...At 24 feet, Minor flooding continues upstream and downstream from the gage located around one half mile upstream from the Georgia Highway 22 and 24 bridge. The parking lot and portions of the Oconee River Greenway Park just downstream from the bridge will be flooded. Low lying areas of woodlands and pasture near the river will be flooded one to two feet deep. Sinclair Dam will likely have two gates open to reach this height.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 4:30 PM EDT Monday the stage was 22.8 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise to 24.8 feet tonight. It will then fall below flood stage Tuesday afternoon to 15.3 feet Wednesday evening. - Flood stage is 22 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas.
Additional information is available at weather.gov/atlanta.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON TO TUESDAY EVENING

area.areaDesc: Baldwin, GA; Washington, GA; Wilkinson, GA
